description.en: The course covers the development of European Union and its instiutions in legal and jurisdictional terms, the legal instruments of the EU, EU legislation and its relationship with national law, proceedings before the Court of Justice of the European Union, the principle of supremacy of the EU law and its relationship with national constitutions, and the protection of fundamental rights in the EU. The political implications of EU law and acquis will also be discussed.

objectives.en: The aim of this course is to give an overview and understanding of the main principles of the EU law and of the legal system at the EU-level. The courses analyses the role of the courts and of the main jurisdictional bodies, the main sources (treaties and rulings), and the specific cases and disputes, also in relation to the national-supranational tension.
